newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Cheyenne busy on takeover.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Cheyenne busy on takeover.

text.p: Options on Cheyenne Software Inc were busy Monday as the stock rallied sharply after Computer Associates said it would buy Cheyenne for $30.50 per share, or about $1.2 billion.
The deal drove Cheyenne Software shares up 7-5/8 to 30 on consolidated volume of 13.6 million shares by 1240 CDT (1740 GMT). The stock reached a high of 30-1/4.
Traders said the deal touched off a flurry of trading in Cheyenne options early but that action slowed by afternoon.
Recent trading in the options did not suggest that some investors were tipped off on the deal, traders said.
Michael Schwartz, a managing director at Oppenheimer & Co, said volume in the Cheyenne October 22-1/2 call over the last two weeks averaged around 300 to 400 contracts a day.
"It just didn't happen overnight," he said of the activity. "It's not something that came out of the blue."
Traders said such a deal had been rumored more than once earlier in the year.

The Cheyenne October 22-1/2 call traded more than 1,700 contracts by 1230 CDT (1730 GMT). It had open interest of 2,340 and was up 6-7/8 at 7-5/8. The December 20 call traded 1,165 contracts and the December 22-1/2 traded 1,025.
A trader at the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE) said investors long the calls were selling off the opening and that activity was seen from both retail and institutional investors.
With the stock rallying, few Cheyenne puts were active. The March 1997 22-1/2 put traded 110 contracts.
Computer Associates options were not busy except for the October 65 call, which traded about 460 contracts.
A trader at the CBOE said volatility on the Computer Associates options did not move.
He said recent trading was also thin except for some buying of front-month calls.
"Earnings are coming out and you do tend to see people buying front-month calls ahead of earnings," he said.
Computer Associates shares were up 1/2 at 63-1/4 on consolidated volume of 997,000.
In other trading, Westell Technologies Inc October 30 put traded more than 3,000 contracts after the stock slumped sharply.
Westell shares were off 12-5/8, or 27 percent, at 33-3/4 on 2.7 million shares.

The stock fell after France's Alcatel Telecom said it was chosen to supply ASDL modems by four regoinal Bell companies, a blow to Westell, which trade press reports said had been expected to share in the order.
The Westell October 30 put had open interest of 20.
The Westell October 35 put, up 2-7/16 at 2-11/16, traded nearly 1,000 contracts. Its open interest was 136.
On the call side, the Westell October 40 call traded nearly 500 contracts. It fell six to 5/8 and its open interest was 213. -Gregory Crawford, 312-408-8750/E-mail: derivatives@reuters.com
